lines.text: Think about John Wayne, Arnold Schwarzenegger. Arnold doesn't dance, he can barely walk.
[at the Academy Awards]

This is Cameron's first nomination and he's in extremely good company. Tonight he joins fellow best actor nominee Paul Newman for "Coot", Clint Eastwood for "Codger", Michael Douglas for "Primary Urges"
[blows him a kiss]
and Steven Seagal for "Snowball in Hell".
[while listening to the "How to be a man" tape]
"Yo!"
Yo!
Hot damn!
Hot damn!
What a fabulous window treatment!
What a fabu...
That was a trick!
Does anybody here know how many times I had to watch Funny Lady?
It was a sequel. She was under contract.
Fuck Barbra Streisand, and you!
Truly manly men do NOT dance.
I've seen all your movies.
Both of them?
Excuse me, are we a little teapot?
Are you really gay?
Hmm Hmm
Was there oh, ANY OTHER TIME YOU MIGHT'VE TOLD ME THIS? I'm wearing a wedding dress, WHICH YOU PICKED OUT!
In prison where it's a substitute and guys in space.
Guys in space?
Well, not on purpose. They just float into each other.

[scene from Cameron's movie, "To Serve and Protect"]
I love you, Billy.
Wait! Do you love me as a friend or in another way?
Another way, Billy!
You mean, as a brother?
No, another way.
You mean, as a cousin?
No! Another way.

[frowns]
You mean, as a penpal?
What was Barbra Streisand's eighth album?
Color Me Barbra.
Stud!
Everybody knows that!
Everybody where? The little gay bar on the prairie?
This is my Peter - uh, my *friend* Peter. We just met at the, uh, intersexual... homosection... INTERSECTION!
"Mom, dad, Sparky, I'm gay."
So what happened?
"But you're so tall...!".
Is everybody gay? Is this a Twilight Zone?

[at confession, about "a friend"]
He's just never had a physical relationship with her.
Never? In three years?
He respects her.
He's gay!
My mom says it won't last.
Your mom's an alcoholic.
I need that wedding. I need some beauty and some music and some placecards before I die. It's like heroin.

Maybe I should thank someone else. Someone who's really been there, someone who taught me a lot, about poetry and Shakespeare, and just, y'know, stayin' awake, man. Someone who's just an overall great guy, a great teacher... to Howard Brackett from Greenleaf, Indiana! And he's gay. Y'know, I've been thinking a lot about this night, and I've decided to dedicate this whole night to a great, gay teacher. Mr. Brackett, WE WON!
so, uh, where were we? Romantic poetry. Shakespeare. Talented. English. Dead.
you're our son, and we'll always love you, gay, straight, red, green, if you rob a bank, if you kill someone.
If you get drunk, climb a clock tower, and take out the town.
As long as you get married.
I'm a member of the community and I don't mind that Howard's gay.
But you're Howard's brother.
[pause]
As you know.
[longer pause]
Well, you know what that means.
[pause]
Uh-oh. I must be gay!
But you're not a parent.
I just came out! At my wedding!
Tom, do I look like a homosexual?
Would you walk for me?
Here, I'll give you your headline! Howard Brackett is a big homo-queer-merry-sissy man. He just came out at his big church wedding. Martha Stewart is fourious!
I need a heterosexual male, CODE RED!
He may be under the influence of something. He may have joined a cult!
That little zombie.

[referring to a hometown actor, who has just outed his son on national television]
He used to mow our lawn. Never again.
Should gays be allowed to handle fresh produce?

[after one of the girls announces that she's gay]
You can't be gay! You're a tramp!
I don't have time. I promised to do that photo shot this afternoon. I have to shower and vomit!
[at confession]
Are you Catholic?
I have a friend who is... and he's very busy.
Gretchen, what do you have for best documentary?
Something 'bout Polish mine workers and their struggle to be free
I'm a horrible person. You have every right to hate me. You should hate me. I want you to hate me! I insist that you hate me! I'm scum, I'm garbage, I'm vermin, an-an-and I'm sorry.
That song always reminds me of our school motto.

[reading in Italian]
Studiare, Imparare, Partire.

[pause]
Study, Learn, Leave.
Eat something, I'm begging you! You look like a swizzle stick.
Food?
I may sue!
Get Johnny Cochrane, not that woman!
A teacher in trouble. A town under siege. A journey to the heartland. Stay tuned.
["how to be a man" tape plays disco music]
For God's sake, don't shake that booty!
[after Howard's dancing is complete]
Well, how did you do... prissy boy.
Look, everyone wants to talk to Diane Sawyer or Joan London, and my network's killing me. They want me blond!
With your coloring?
Eat something. You look like a swizzle stick!
You mean, food?
I'm gay, I came out.
To whom?
Who? To everyone. My folks, my boss... my dog.
This is where I grew up.
I don't care.
Sonja, we're here to help someone. For once, we're gonna think about something besides our careers and our hair.
